content: I believe that a good social science will provide us with the answers to fundamental problems that life on earth faces in this historical colonial-modern stage. With several colleagues, we are working hard to lay the foundations of an interdisciplinary social sciences research center in Latin America. As a Social Anthropologist, I am currently finishing a PhD in Computer Science, developing the Computational Social Science area in one of the main scientific centers of the southern hemisphere. Additionally, I am leading a large group of young anthropologists, who have already begun to train in mathematics and computational science. I just hope that our work will serve the historical project that reveres life over profitability.
summary: I believe that a good social science will provide us with the answers to fundamental problems that life on earth faces in this historical colonial-modern stage. With several colleagues, we are working hard to lay the foundations of an interdisciplinary social sciences research center in Latin America. As a Social Anthropologist, I am currently finishing a PhD in Computer Science, developing the Computational Social Science area in one of the main scientific centers of the southern hemisphere.
title: Gustavo Landfried

content: Playing as a team with same partners enable us to early acquire individual skills that would hardly be achieved by playing alone. These results allow us to rethink new teaching-learning strategies, highlights the cover of the faculty of sciences magazine.
summary: Social learning. Better the devil you know.
title: Cover note of the faculty of science magazine
Faculty of science computer programming workshop (with Python)

content: Workshop In the workshop, tools for complex systems applied to social systems were presented. It was organized under a theoretical-practical modality and seminars of invited professors. The objective was to create a space for the encounter between the social sciences and the rest of the scientific disciplines. It was a great opportunity to exchange ideas on how to apply the tools used for complex systems to problems coming from the social area.
summary: Bayesian inference tools applied to study how we learn.
title: Social learning in cultural evolution contexts

summary: The hacked belief approach, and the Bayesian inference to the rescue.
title: Evidence in favor of a scientific theory

summary: Playing as a team with same partners enable us to acquire individual skills that would hardly be achieved by playing alone.
title: Faithfulness-boost effect

content: The first skill estimator was developed by Arpad Elo, adopted by the World Chess Federations around 1970. TrueSkill is just the bayesian multiplayer version of Elo model, published by Microsoft in 2007. In this technical report I derive, step by step, the analytical solution of the model.
summary: The first skill estimator was developed by Arpad Elo, adopted by the World Chess Federations around 1970. TrueSkill is just the bayesian multiplayer version of Elo model, published by Microsoft in 2007. In this technical report I derive, step by step, the analytical solution of the model.
title: TrueSkill, Technical Report

Welcome to Slides Academic
Features  Efficiently write slides in Markdown 3-in-1: Create, Present, and Publish your slides Supports speaker notes Mobile friendly slides  Controls  Next: Right Arrow or Space Previous: Left Arrow Start: Home Finish: End Overview: Esc Speaker notes: S Fullscreen: F Zoom: Alt + Click PDF Export: E  Code Highlighting Inline code: variable
Code block:
porridge = "blueberry" if porridge == "blueberry": print("Eating...")  Math In-line math: $x + y = z$
Block math:
$$ f\left( x \right) = \;\frac{{2\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x - 4} \right)}}{{\left( {x + 4} \right)\left( {x + 1} \right)}} $$
Fragments Make content appear incrementally
{{% fragment %}} One {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} **Two** {{% /fragment %}} {{% fragment %}} Three {{% /fragment %}}  Press Space to play!
One  Two  Three 
A fragment can accept two optional parameters:
 class: use a custom style (requires definition in custom CSS) weight: sets the order in which a fragment appears  Speaker Notes Add speaker notes to your presentation
{{% speaker_note %}} - Only the speaker can read these notes - Press `S` key to view {{% /speaker_note %}}  Press the S key to view the speaker notes!
 Only the speaker can read these notes Press S key to view   Themes  black: Black background, white text, blue links (default) white: White background, black text, blue links league: Gray background, white text, blue links beige: Beige background, dark text, brown links sky: Blue background, thin dark text, blue links   night: Black background, thick white text, orange links serif: Cappuccino background, gray text, brown links simple: White background, black text, blue links solarized: Cream-colored background, dark green text, blue links  Custom Slide Customize the slide style and background
{{< slide background-image="/img/boards.jpg" >}} {{< slide background-color="#0000FF" >}} {{< slide class="my-style" >}}  Custom CSS Example Let’s make headers navy colored.
Create assets/css/reveal_custom.css with:
.reveal section h1, .reveal section h2, .reveal section h3 { color: navy; }  Questions? Ask

summary: An introduction to using Academic's Slides feature.
title: Slides

content: Humans had an adaptive leap when they developed the ability to imitate, to acquire information based on the experience of others. This allowed learning and memory decentralization in a population of agents, leading to a process of cultural evolution in which valuable knowledge emerges even if it is too costly for it to be discovered by individual agents. We are working on a social reinforcement learning model, based on individual experience and social learning transmition, in order to study non-analytical properties of the cultural evolution process.
title: Artificial cultural evolution algorithm

content: We exploit the virtually infinite repository of human behavior available in Internet to study a relevant topic in anthropological science: how social learning strategies may affect human skill acquisition.
summary: Online games are ideal for studying human skill acquisition.
title: Social learning factors in online games

content:
Beyond any debate, what is certain is that Bayesian Inference allows us to optimally update our beliefs given a model and a data set. What more could you ask for?
Handbooks Some initial bibliography
 Lee M.D. and Wagenmakers E.J. Bayesian Cognitive Modeling: A Practical Course Richard McElreath. Statistical Rethinking: A Bayesian Course with Examples in R and Stan Andrew Gelman et al. Bayesian Data Analysis  Evidence in favor of a scientific theory In a 1935 paper and in his book Theory of Probability, Jeffreys developed a methodology for quantify the evidence in favor of a scientific theory. Bayesian model selection automatically encodes a preference for simpler, more constrained models. Many of the “machine learning” regularization techniques can be seen as an approximation to Bayesian inference.
 Tom Minka. Evidence Larry Wasserman. Bayesian Model Selection and Model Averaging Robert Kass and Adrian Raftery Bayes factors and model uncertainty
summary: The method that optimally update our beliefs, given a model and a data set.
title: Bayesian Inference

title: Algebra (with Haskell)

content: The only agents capable of developing successful solutions to complex problems are the peoples through their evolutionary history (Rita Segato, Elinor Ostrom, Robert Boyd). The advance of the colonial-modern proyect, under the figure of the Republican States and private enterprises, destroys much of the cultural diversity accumulated over thousands of years by human populations. It is therefore necessary to restore the jurisdictional and deliberative autonomy of peoples in order to guarantee the process of cultural evolution, the only means capable of solving the serious ecological and economic problems that humanity faces today.
summary: How cultural evolution process could solve actual ecological and economic problems.
title: Cultural diverisity at the colonial-modernity period
